what: Select the “Center of data” for planar models
title: Processing of Coordinate Data
text: Now, user may choose “0th meridian” “180th meridian” center data. important longitudes shifted respective center map model run. selecting “0th meridian” longitudes transposed range (-180, 180) degrees, selecting “180th meridian” longitudes transposed range (0, 360) degrees. enables planar model understand e.g. data around Pacific “belongs together” data different sides planar map using longitudes (-180, 180) degrees Pacific data. Center Data setting different center modeling plotting (includes predictions), warning. Data west coast South America missing since longitudes transposed range (0, 360) degrees, plot Atlantic center shows range (-180, 180) degrees. Warning Centering missmatch

what: How does “border correction for pacific” work?
title: Processing of Coordinate Data
text: Starting Atlantic-centered map (green) create duplicates borders edges map. duplicates contain data original map (green). maps left right (yellow) just shifted maps. maps (light dark blue) mirrored maps. , data one edge map “meet” data respective edge map. model calculation run whole “big” map (3x3 map) without knowing borders -. model know data duplicated 9 different sections map. approach works perfectly fine Bayesian modelling used. Border correction idea applying Bayesian modelling little data iterations, inherent randomness Bayesian modelling provide different estimates “inner borders” “big” map. leads estimates match borders central (green) map, since show central (green) map visualize estimates. , effect disappear number iterations increased. don’t shift data? catch case local data Pacific. data spreads along longitudes, still border Atlantic. solution general. global data, recommendation use “spherical” modelling ever possible order avoid inconsistencies borders.
